New Records: Erling Haaland became Norway’s record scorer at the age of 24 with a double in his country’s 3-0 win over Slovakia
Key Match Events: Jude Bellingham equalized for England in the 87th minute
Vangelis Pavlidis scored the opener for Greece in the 49th minute
Pavlidis took advantage of more sloppy defending to grab Greece’s winner in the fourth minute of stoppage time
Pre-Game Insights: England’s interim coach Lee Carsley felt emboldened enough to field a team without a recognized striker in the absence of injured captain Harry Kane
Carsley insisted it was not an “experiment” but a case of trying something different with the players they have
Post-Match Reflections: Carsley said “We never really gave ourselves a chance to see whether it was the right decision or wrong” after the loss to Greece
Pavlidis said in a tribute to George Baldock, the Panathinaikos defender who was found dead in his Athens home on Wednesday, that the team “gave everything for him”
Miscellaneous Highlights: France won without Kylian Mbappé and the retired Antoine Griezmann
Italy forward Lorenzo Pellegrini’s red card proved decisive as his team squandered a two-goal lead and drew with Belgium 2-2 in Rome
